messages.content: ComfyUI_FlipStreamViewer is a tool that provides a viewer interface for flipping images with frame interpolation, allowing users to watch high-fidelity pseudo-videos without needing AnimateDiff.
How do I install custom nodes via ComfyUI-Manager?

To install custom nodes via ComfyUI-Manager, navigate to the custom_nodes directory of ComfyUI. Clone the repository: `git clone https://github.com/sakura1bgx/ComfyUI_FlipStreamViewer.git`. Once installed, they can be used by loading the `workflow.json` file located in the `workflows` folder.
What is the ComfyUI Impact Pack?
The ComfyUI Impact Pack is a custom node required for using ComfyUI_FlipStreamViewer. It needs to be installed via ComfyUI-Manager.
What is a preset in ComfyUI_FlipStreamViewer?
A preset in ComfyUI_FlipStreamViewer is used to save and load preset files. Presets can be created in the `preset` directory and loaded from the right pane of the viewer.
The 'Nfrm' parameter controls the number of frames; each frame undergoes x8 interpolation in the sample workflow.
What is the function of the 'pre text', 'append text', and 'frameN text' sections in the prompt format?
The 'pre text' and 'append text' sections apply to all frames, while each line of 'frameN text' applies individually to frames. The '{lora}' section is replaced by the LoRA input contents.
What is the purpose of the 'M' button in the ComfyUI_FlipStreamViewer controls?
The 'M' button in the ComfyUI_FlipStreamViewer controls is used to move the checkpoint file.
